title: How do headphones work without batteries? - Quora

response.answer_text: Headphones typically contain passive speakers. The speaker cone is moved by the electrical energy produced by a line-level signal from the source device. The batteries are usually for the additional features, like Bluetooth or Active Noise Cancellation. You can read all about it in the blog article below. Why Some Headphones Need to be Charged (and Others Do Not)

The simple answer is that a wired headphone’s drivers are powered by an amplifier which supplies the voltage and current necessary to move them. An amplifier is needed because the signal would otherwise be “line level,” which is too low to drive them satisfactorily. An iPod or mobile phone’s built-in amp may be adequate, but many users prefer a separate unit specifically made for the purpose.
